byline.original: By PETER BAKER and GARDINER HARRIS

abstract: White House Letter; Pres Obama arrives in New York to attend United Nations General Assembly with specific goals for advancing United States'  foreign policy interests, including relations with Russia and encouraging cooperation on climate change; way Obama will interact with other leaders will show degree to which those leaders' country's goals line up with Obama's.
lead_paragraph: At the United Nations on Monday, President Obama will navigate a sea of world leaders with whom he has varying levels of rapport, including President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

headline.main: Clues to U.S. Relationships Can Be Seen in U.N. Body Language
headline.print_headline: Clues to U.S. Relationships Can Be Seen in U.N. Body Language

snippet: At the United Nations on Monday, President Obama will navigate a sea of world leaders with whom he has varying levels of rapport, including President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
